intro: Melothria cunninghamii var. major, commonly known as the giant false cucumber, is a climbing vine native to Australia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that can grow up to 30 cm in length, with a rough, spiny surface. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
